author: siladu
content:
yesterday on msf-1, <@524738020033691659> noticed a besu bug where for blockValue in getPayload we were failing to stuff 256 bytes into an 8 byte long  `java.lang.ArithmeticException: Value does not fit a 8 byte long`
If we don't already have it, a good test would be an excessively large blockValue (e.g. https://github.com/hyperledger/besu/commit/48702aa12e535e08b0dd4b0e911b1757003e3a1d#diff-d5c1b091ebef72e446cd515d81bd83794f96019cff29940ff9407aed9cb0df23R96)
cc <@360491619402776577>

Genesis 8:30 UTC on 25th Jan: ```withdrawal-devnet-4 key allocation:
Prysm:
EL-prysm - 180k validators 5/node - 36 node (30%)
Lighthouse:
EL-lighthouse - 180k validators 5k/node - 36 nodes (30%) + 1000 validator evil node
Teku:
EL-teku -  75k validators 5k/node - 15 nodes 13% total
Lodestar + ethereumjs:
EL-lodestar 60k validators 5k/node - 12 nodes 10% total
Nimbus
EL-nimbus  70k validators 5k/node - 14 nodes 12% total
------------
Total validators ran by EF: 565k
Extra validators: 40k
- Jim 30k
- Grandine 5k (?) 
- Others - client teams (5k)
----
Total validators: 605k```

author: barnabasbusa

author: barnabasbusa
content: Devnet 4 is relaunching in 13h: https://withdrawal-devnet-4.ethpandaops.io Bootnode is configured, all nodes are configured. If you can please check on your node, and report if you notice any issue before genesis hits.
